name: Introduction to Public Opinion
description: This course introduces students to the concepts of public opinion and survey methods. It covers the origins and components of public opinion, survey design and sampling, data collection methods, and data analysis. It also touches on the cultural and political implications of public opinion.

name: Political Behaviour
description: This course provides an overview of the behaviour of individuals and groups in the political process. It covers topics such as voting behaviour, interest groups, political socialization, and political participation. It also examines the role of the media and public opinion in shaping political behaviour.

name: Applied Research Methods in Political Science
description: This course provides an introduction to research methods in political science. Students will learn how to design and conduct research, how to interpret results, and how to present their findings. The course will cover topics such as sampling, hypothesis testing, survey design, and data analysis.

name: Public Opinion and Mass Media
description: This course explores the relationship between public opinion and the mass media. It covers topics such as the effects of political advertising, the role of the media in shaping public opinion, and the role of technology in public opinion formation. It also examines the role of the media in the formation of public opinion in different contexts.
prerequisites: Applied Research Methods in Political Science
